He revolutionized retail with Vishal Mega Mart, offering affordable essentials to middle-class families. Despite a major setback in 2011, Agarwal made a powerful comeback with V2 Retail, solidifying his status as a retail icon.

title: U.S. Supreme Court strikes down Trump Tariffs; new 10% global duty under trade act raises global concerns
description: The U.S. Supreme Court, in a 6–3 ruling, struck down former President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariff orders, holding that the International Emergency Economic Powers Act does not authorise import taxes. Hours later, Trump announced a new 10% global tariff under the Trade Act of 1974. The move has triggered global reactions, including from India and the European Union, and raised questions over the fate of $133 billion collected under the invalidated duties.

title: Family of three injured in suspected gas cylinder blast in Delhi’s Madanpur Khadar
description: A suspected gas cylinder blast injured a family of three in southeast Delhi’s Madanpur Khadar area early Saturday morning. The Delhi Fire Services received a call at 4:46 AM and rushed three fire tenders to the spot. All three injured were shifted to Safdarjung Hospital. Authorities are investigating the cause of the explosion.

description: In a heartfelt revelation, actor Rajpal Yadav, who was recently released on interim bail from Tihar Jail to attend his niece's wedding, noted that the greatest challenge during his incarceration was the emotional toll of being away from family. Emphasizing the importance of mental well-being, he maintained a positive outlook throughout his ordeal. Read on to know more in detail.

description: Effective management of lymphoedema depends on both clinical care and self-care. Investigations often uncover conflicting claims, with authorities relying on CCTV, eyewitnesses, and forensic evidence to establish the true driver. This pattern highlights the challenges in determining responsibility and the vulnerability of drivers in such cases.

description: The Supreme Court ruled President Trump cannot use emergency powers for certain tariffs, impacting his trade strategy but not the trade war. Despite this, Trump announced new tariffs under the Trade Act of 1974, aiming for similar revenue despite a more complex legal process. Importers face ongoing uncertainty as the administration navigates new legal avenues for tariff enforcement.

Police allege a conspiracy to defame India, citing anti-national slogans and T-shirts targeting the Prime Minister. Investigators are probing potential foreign funding and a larger plot, with three officers reportedly injured during the incident.

Footage shows highway swallowed by gas cloud after Chile truck explosion — watch
description: A liquefied gas truck explosion on a highway in Santiago, Chile, resulted in at least four fatalities and 17 injuries. The blast, which occurred in the Renca district, sent a large gas cloud across the highway and damaged numerous vehicles. President Gabriel Boric confirmed government teams are assisting affected populations due to smoke in the area.

BJP protests nationwide in response to Congress' 'topless' AI Summit protest
description: BJP staged nationwide protests after Indian Youth Congress workers disrupted the India AI Impact Summit, displaying slogans against PM Modi. Four IYC leaders were arrested. BJP workers also showed black flags to Rahul Gandhi in Mumbai, accusing the Congress of an 'anti-national' act and demanding an apology for the 'shameful' summit disruption.

title: 'KHxRK' reunion: Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan reunite for a quirky film
description: Superstars Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan have reunited for a quirky film, tentatively titled 'KHxRK', with Nelson Dilipkumar directing. The promo, released today, has generated significant buzz, hinting at a blend of humor, nostalgia, and visual appeal. Anirudh Ravichander is composing the music for this highly anticipated project, promising a vintage cinematic experience for fans after a 45-year gap.

title: Mira Murati's Thinking Machines loses top exec to Sam Altman's OpenAI amid spat
description: OpenAI continues to poach top talent from Mira Murati's Thinking Machines Lab, with Jolene Parish being the latest executive to return to the ChatGPT maker. This follows the departures of CTO Barret Zoph, Luke Metz, and Sam Schoenholz. The exodus highlights a fierce talent war, with Zoph's exit reportedly stemming from alleged "unethical conduct" and workplace relationship issues.

description: A 32-year-old woman, Sangeeta, was fatally shot by her husband, Dilip Yadav, during a marital dispute in Faridabad. The couple was undergoing divorce proceedings. Dilip, accompanied by family, confronted Sangeeta at her parents' home, leading to an argument and the fatal shooting. Both Dilip and his brother-in-law are currently at large.

Security has been heightened in the capital's sensitive areas.

Sharma, with a background in AI and platform leadership, aims to refocus on Xbox's core audience amidst industry challenges like slowing revenue and intense competition. This significant leadership shift signals a strategic reset for Xbox.

title: 'Inform parents': Gujarat may tweak marriage norms
Caught cheating, told to leave: Student assaults professor in Karnataka college; video viral
description: A student at a Kalaburagi private homoeopathy college attacked a lecturer after being caught copying during an exam. The lecturer confiscated the student's answer sheet and asked him to leave, prompting the enraged student to assault him. The college has barred the student from further exams, but no complaint has been filed.

title: 14-year-old Dalit girl dies by suicide after molester gets bail
description: A 14-year-old Dalit girl in Lakhimpur Kheri was found dead after allegedly being threatened by a man accused of molesting her, who was recently released on bail. Her family claims she was under immense stress following the threats. An FIR has been registered against the accused for abetment of suicide and under the SC/ST Act.
